Detailed Description

template<typename Tuple, std::size_t N = std::tuple_size<Tuple>::value>
struct arrow::stl::SchemaFromTuple< Tuple, N >

Build an arrow::Schema based upon the types defined in a std::tuple-like structure.

While the type information is available at compile-time, we still need to add the column names at runtime, thus these methods are not constexpr.

Member Typedef Documentation

◆ Element

template<typename Tuple , std::size_t N = std::tuple_size<Tuple>::value>
using arrow::stl::SchemaFromTuple< Tuple, N >::Element = typename std::tuple_element<N - 1, Tuple>::type

Member Function Documentation

◆ MakeSchema() [1/2]

template<typename Tuple , std::size_t N = std::tuple_size<Tuple>::value>
static std::shared_ptr<Schema> arrow::stl::SchemaFromTuple< Tuple, N >::MakeSchema ( const std::vector< std::string > &  names)
inlinestatic

Build a Schema from the types of the tuple-like structure passed in as template parameter assign the column names at runtime.

An example usage of this API can look like the following:

using TupleType = std::tuple<int, std::vector<std::string>>;
std::shared_ptr<Schema> schema =
SchemaFromTuple<TupleType>::MakeSchema({"int_column", "list_of_strings_column"});

inlinestatic

Build a Schema from the types of the tuple-like structure passed in as template parameter assign the column names at runtime.

An example usage of this API can look like the following:

using TupleType = std::tuple<int, std::vector<std::string>>;
std::shared_ptr<Schema> schema =
SchemaFromTuple<TupleType>::MakeSchema({"int_column", "list_of_strings_column"});

◆ MakeSchemaRecursion()

template<typename Tuple , std::size_t N = std::tuple_size<Tuple>::value>
static std::vector<std::shared_ptr<Field> > arrow::stl::SchemaFromTuple< Tuple, N >::MakeSchemaRecursion ( const std::vector< std::string > &  names)
inlinestatic

Recursively build a vector of arrow::Field from the defined types.

In most cases MakeSchema is the better entrypoint for the Schema creation.
